line_1: Thousands will fain thy little heart ensnare,
line_2: For without danger none like thee are fair;

line_1: Not Pride nor Envy, &c. for this doth insnare,
line_2: A Sin with which there's none can compare,

line_1: And, when they could the painted Fowls insnare,
line_2: Or pierce the savage Beast in sylvan War,

line_1: And Those, whose Arts the feather'd World ensnare,
line_2: Nor mighty Pain endure, nor pensive Care.

line_1: Now harmless birds in silken nets insnare,
line_2: Now with swift dogs pursue the flying hare;

line_1: Now harmless birds in silken nets insnare,
line_2: Dull sports! for oh my CHLOE is not there!

line_1: Two milk-white doves officious to ensnare:
line_2: A grateful present for my softer fair.

line_1: Who finds, when Love does faithful Breasts insnare,
line_2: These boding Symptoms fright the Charming Fair,

line_1: Who finds, when Love does faithful Breasts insnare,
line_2: They're wrack'd with Jealous Fears, and every tender Care.

line_1: Vainly the king she would ensnare,
line_2: For him, her words dissolv'd in air;

line_1: Which, in loose bondage, wou'd ensnare
Fair Tresses Man's Imperial Race insnare,
line_2: And Beauty draws us with a single Hair.

line_1: Hail loftiest art! thou can'st all hearts insnare,
line_2: And make the fairest still appear more fair.

line_1: Small waists and slender limbs some hearts ensnare,
line_2: While others love the more substantial fair.
